page.title: 05 FARMING LIVESTOCK
page.content: In the village there is a piggery which has approx. 14,000 pigs.The breeds of pig kept are{Large White}and {Landrace Cross}. The pigs at this piggery are weaned at three weeks old and sold at 90kg in weight.They have about 2.5 litters per sow per year.They sell about 24 pigs per sow per year.The pigs are raised mainly for Pork. Cattle are raised mainly for Beef.The main breeds are{Charolais Cross, {Hereford Cross}and {Limosin Cross}.The young bullocks are bought from a dealer in Wales and they are fattened on the farm and then sent to Louth Fatstock Market to be sold.
